result.execSummary:
All charges against Monte Lee Brown in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Monte Lee Brown is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monte Lee Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monte Lee Brown in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Monte Lee Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Monte Lee Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Monte Lee Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties advise Court that case remains in trial posture and have no pretrial motions.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 9/26/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motions in Limine

Defendant Monte Lee Brown in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Monte Lee Brown in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  
Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Ertl has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it with his client.  Court ordered the defendant to contact counsel to set up a meeting.  Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PR.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Monte Lee Brown in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1p
